arts.ttl: Fulham vs Arsenal team news LIVE on Sky!
arts.sum: Mikel Arteta's Gunners come out of the international break not just as Premier League leaders, but also favourites to win the title for the first time in two-and-a-half years. Welcome to our live coverage of Fulham vs Arsenal which is live on Sky Sports Premier League, with kick-off at 5.30pm.

arts.ttl: Fulham vs Arsenal live: Gunners look to extend lead at top of Premier League
arts.sum: Arsenal could extend their lead at the top of the Premier League table to four points as they travel to Fulham

arts.ttl: Marco Silva plays down Arsenal’s injury problems
arts.sum: Arsenal will go into their Premier League match against Fulham today without several key players, but Fulham manager Marco Silva insists that injuries should not be used as an excuse. arts.ttl: Arsenal’s Injury Issues Laughed Off by Fulham Manager Marco Silva
arts.sum: Martin Ødegaard has joined Noni Madueke and Kai Havertz on the sidelines for the Gunners.

arts.ttl: Seventh heaven: Arsenal can extend club-record defensive streak in Fulham clash
arts.sum: Arsenal could prolong a unique club-record streak when they travel to Fulham for Saturday evening's Premier League London derby, but a former Gunner is well-placed to ruin that run.

arts.ttl: How to watch Fulham vs Arsenal: TV channel, live stream and kick-off time
arts.sum: Arsenal will travel to Fulham on Saturday with an opportunity to extend their lead at the summit of the Premier League table as domestic action returns after the international break

arts.ttl: “No-one is stopping Arsenal” Chris Sutton predicts the Fulham v Arsenal game
arts.sum: Chris Sutton believes that Arsenal are now firmly on course to win another Premier League title this season after moving to the top of the league table. The former striker shared his views while previewing the Gunners’ upcoming match against Fulham, expressing strong confidence that Mikel Arteta’s side will continue their dominant run of form.
